paper_title: Effect of ice nucleating proteins on the structure-property relationships of ice: A molecular dynamics study

claims.claim: At T = 230 K, polycrystalline ice containing 32 grains exhibits a tensile yield stress of approximately 300 MPa, as determined from the stress–strain response
instruction: Run Eval24.ipynb. The notebook loads the tensile stress–strain data from W-32.dat and applies the 0.2% offset method by drawing a line starting at a strain of 0.002, with a slope equal to the elastic modulus obtained from the linear elastic region of the stress–strain curve. The offset line and the stress–strain curves are plotted together
Verify that the offset line intersects the stress–strain curve at a stress of approximately 0.30 GPa (300 MPa)
